Reviews.Title: “Economical and convenient”
Reviews.Author: deenag
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times in the past year and would recommend it highly if you are looking for something inexpensive and close to Boston/Brookline. The rooms are pretty standard but the three biggest benefits are: 1. free parking, and not in a scary underground garage; 2. free internet; 3. free breakfast. For those without a car, it's about a block walk to the T. The rooms also have fridges and, I think, microwaves. Another plus. The decor won't wow you and the sheets aren't Pratesi but who cares? Save your $$$ and spend it on all the wonderful culture and food that Boston has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Clean and Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DrumBob
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston this past weekend to see my friend's band play at the Brighton Music Hall. I wanted a hotel that was clean and comfortable, close to the venue, and reasonably priced with free parking. I got all those things at the Best Western Terrace. My room was spotlessly clean, small and not lavishly furnished, but nice, and it only cost me $89 for the night, a serious bargain in Boston. The staff was friendly and helpful, the continental breakfast was very good with many choices, and I would definitely stay here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough!”
Reviews.Author: recmouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although a little tricky to get to, is in a good area. We were picking up our son from Boston University and it was only 5 minutes away from him. It's very close to Boston College as well. The T-line is super close to the hotel also. The rooms could definitely use some updating but they were comfortable, clean and quiet. The breakfast in the morning had a lot of options and was very good. The big bonus to staying here... FREE PARKING!

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous parking and staff”
Reviews.Author: Liketogothere
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a joke. It is on the side of a hill, we could barely get out of the car because of how steep the hill we had to park on. The htl staff called us (my mom and I) in the middle of the night saying to us that there were complaints that our room was being too noisy....we were asleep, it was 1:00am. There was noise from outside but it was not us. After being startled at that hour we were awake for a few hours. I asked the next morning if they made a habit of calling their guests in the middle of the night without checking to see if they had the right room, they insisted they checked, which of course we know that they couldn't have because they would have seen that our room was dark and quiet. Please check your windows to be sure they are locked ours we both unlocked, this place is basically a motel. I would never stay there again and would recommend that no one stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but funcional”
Reviews.Author: loppy
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights over thanksgiving weekend. The first room"s toilet was not working so were given another room that was larger and on the first floor. Bed was comfortable, room was clean (bedspread of first room;s bed was rather garish) with free WI-fi and free breakfast. Small room for breakfast but we wound up with a table. Good overall value for a hotel room in the middle of Brookline, Mass.. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a challenging stay here”
Reviews.Author: DawnWayne_NewJersey
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights while looking at colleges. The staff was very friendly and the location, although a bit far from Boston, was very convenient to the T. Unfortunately, our room was not cleaned for two out of the three days we were there. I notified the hotel desk and there was no housekeeping available after 4 p.m. to correct the situation. It was very unpleasant to have to clean my own hotel room;empty garbage cans, change the towels, make my bed and have dirty floors. In addition, the bed was very soft, the leg on the only table was off, the heat couldn't be adjusted and was uncomfortably warm and the bathroom window was broken. The management apologized and made a financial adjustment but the cost was still way more than what it should have been under the conditions we had to tolerate.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and very, very clean”
Reviews.Author: DDinPA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-night stay at the Boston Best Western Terrace Inn. Our party consisted of myself, my husband and our 21 year-old daughter. We were in town to visit our son at BU over Parents Weekend. First of all, getting ANY hotel during this weekend is 1) a challenge and 2) expensive. It is the same weekend as the Head of the Charles Regatta during which 300k people descend on the city. In addition, there were several other college events on the same weekendâ€¦.all within about a 7 mile radius. I booked the Terrace through a third-party provider â€“ the least pleasant part of our experience, but I will save that for another review â€“ and got a rate of $209.99 per night. Pricey for this hotel, but hey, the demand is there and it was by far the least expensive option when compared to the few others that actually had rooms. And we booked several months prior. I cannot stress enough how unbelievably friendly and helpful the staff is at this hotel. At check-in Jing was a doll. Our reservation indicated one queen bed, and even though they were packed, he managed to get us into a room with two doubles so our daughter actually had a place to sleep. He did all of this while smiling and being genuinely friendly the entire time. It really set the tone for the entire weekend. The hotel has a funky, LA-boutique/bungalow hotel style feel to it. A low-slung design nestled amidst a leafy residential neighborhood on the back side of Comm Ave. Whole Foods is a pleasant, quick 2 block walk through the neighborhood. The grounds are well groomed and very, very clean; even with the falling leaves, it was kept neat. As others have mentioned, the parking is free which, in Boston, can save you upwards of $50 a day. I am a super freak for cleanliness in hotels. I know it sounds weird, but the first thing I do is turn down the comforters and check out the sheets. In this case, crisp, white and clean and passed with flying colors. Nice, full pillows and the mattresses are topped and soft. I then move into the bathroom and inspect the tub, shower and corners of the room. The Terrace shower has the higher-end bowed shower curtain rod which provides additional room and the liner was fabric; a super alternative to the cold, often moldy plastic variety. The tub was spotless and the water pressure and temp was perfect for long, hot showers. Pantene hair care products are provided along with face and body bars and a hair dryer. (A fantastic addition would be a swing-arm lighted magnifier mirror, but thatâ€™s just me.) The towels are commercially stiff, but snow white and much thicker than you might expect. The first night in, we walked the 2.2 miles to BU West. It took about 40 minutes and we were moving, but it felt good after our 8 hour car ride. (We could have hopped the T at the Washington St. stop which is right down the block from the hotel; very, very convenient.) We felt very safe on the walk and we passed several quaint restaurants on the way. The walk back was an hourâ€¦.our very own â€œheartbreak hillâ€� going up that last stretch! The breakfast is far more substantial than you might imagine and actually offered a bit of variety over the course of our 2 day stay. There is a diverse array of breads â€“ muffins, fruited, bagels, farmhouse white and even toaster-ready French toast â€“ and all of the condiments; fresh fruit; mini-cheese omeletâ€™s and sausage (perfect for breakfast sandwiches); made-to-order Belgian Waffles; yogurt and hot and cold cereals; regular and caffeine-free coffee; tea; hot chocolate and orange and cranberry juice. (Add this value to the money saved with the free parking and you can see how this would impact your travel budget.) The dining room can get full depending on your time of arrival and the census, but if you cannot find a seat, simply use the provided trays to carry your food back to your room. Alicia, the dining room attendant on duty during our stay, is charming. She smiled and chatted with us all while never stopping the seemingly incessant chore of restocking and making coffee; another high mark for the stellar customer service that is obviously a standard at this hotel. (Of course, your experience will be impacted by other diners, and there were some class A jerks in there when we were having breakfast, but Alicia smiled through everything and continued to do a great jobâ€¦I have no idea how they put up with some of those peopleâ€¦travelers, mind your doggone manners!) There are two computers in the lobby and free Wifi. I didnâ€™t even need to break out my netbook as I hopped on their machine to print out our BU parking pass. The gal on front desk duty â€“ I am so mad I forgot to get her name â€“ was beyond helpful in so many ways. She helped us print several documents and then came to check out our situation with our remote which wasnâ€™t working. When she couldnâ€™t get it to work, she summoned a maintenance guy â€“ another super friendly, skilled staffer â€“ and he had us fixed up in a few minutes. While in our room waiting, the front desk attendant filled us in on where to go and we ended up taking her advice on lunch at The Joshua Tree in Davis. (A great find for reasonably priced burgers, good service and a cool neighborhood.) So, to wrap up, I would highly recommend the Best Western Terrace Inn in Boston. The facility itself may not be the Four Seasons, but I can tell you, I would put the level of customer service up against the best hotels I have stayed inâ€¦including the Mondrian AND several Ritz and Four Seasons locations. I am not even kidding; these folks could work at ANY of those places. If it is any indication of how comfortable guests feel while at the Terrace, just check out how many repeat customers there areâ€¦we met multiple families in the dining room who never stay anywhere else when in Boston. People do not go back to places that are dumps or where the staff treats them poorly; no matter the price point. Bravo to the staff and management of the Terrace. You do a fantastic job. And we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but basic”
Reviews.Author: MXLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights when attending a conference in Boston. The good things: cheap compared to other places in Boston; convenient for the T subway; area is safe; staff are friendly; free fast wifi; free breakfast (bagels, fruit, coffee, juice, cereal). Bad things: very dated room, poorly equipped (oven but no pots or pans; coffee filters, cups and coffee but no coffee maker (and they couldn't get one for us)); room was clean but smelt musty; the T from here is extremely slow (>30 minutes to Hynes convention centre, nearly an hour to MGH or Harvard Square). Summary: It's good value for Boston and has free parking if that's important to you. It definitely feels more like a motel than a hotel. I think next time I'd pay more and stay somewhere more central and more up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Try it . . you'll like it!!”
Reviews.Author: gailtg
Reviews.Content: Okay, it's not the Ritz. . . . but if you are looking for a clean, modest hotel that is convenient to the St. Elizabeth Hospital and the B-line .. as well as FREE wi-fi, FREE breakfast and FREE parking . . look no further. It's in a safe community .. walking distance to a couple of great restaurants (Tasca Tapas and Bamboo Thai), and Whole Foods. My room had a microwave and a small refrigerator. The staff were always pleasant. The only issue was that the breakfast foods / area was cleaned up and put away consistently before the 10:00 am posted times. Three days in a week . .the gal was putting breakfast away early - once at 9:10 am and once was at 9:30. Annoyed quite a few people. If they corrected this problem .. . . it would have been a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: 63bananas
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel near Boston College. Clean rooms. Don't be put off by the lack of curb appeal. Friendly staff, good breakfast, ideal for college visits.

Reviews.Title: “Many Pros - Need to fix the Cons”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in the past and the Location is excellent - right on the T-line. Staff is amazing; breakfast very good. Free Parking for 'inner city' Boston. However the property is showing its age. Issues were - toilet ran, light over bed had to be toggled on/off/on/off repeatedly to get it to work, bathtub had rusty soap dish (30% Rust - not just a spot). Please fix the fixable things and I will be proud once again to recommend this property to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised! Great place to stay in Boston!!”
Reviews.Author: jenoren
Reviews.Content: My family and I had been on the Cape for a week and wanted to stay in Boston for a couple of days to explore . I choose bw terrace inn because of the reviews I read, location, and price. It exceeded in all categories! Rooms were a little dated, but clean, staff was friendly, but we didn't see them much. The T station was about a 5-7 minute walk and was super accessible for us small town peeps :). Loved the fRee parking as I found everywhere out east had parking fees. We did the aquarium and museum of science packages. What an awesome deal! No lines to wait in, and let me tell u there was a huge one! We ate one night in the city at Cheers :). But the other we stopped at the Thai place Bamboo on the walk back from the T station. Great food and fast! My only thing I wasn't terribly pleased with the free breakfast eggs were awful but my taste I guess.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Deal in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: jlinds86
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a couple nights because 1. It was the cheapest hotel in Boston, and 2. It was a block from my brother's apartment. The hotel room was very nice, though the first room we got the thermostat was set at 95, so it was boiling. We were given a different room, one that was much cooler. The next morning the hot water for the entire building was down. The breakfast was good, with a very good selection. Other than the few minor setbacks at the beginning of our stay, the hotel was wonderful! Good rooms and service in a good location!

Reviews.Title: “Good location away from Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Mid50
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews for Boston hotels months before our travel and chose this hotel because best reviews, it had free parking, yet close to train (buy a Charley card in 7/11 store for $9 for the day for public transport (but not for tour buses). Arrived in Boston at 6pm traffic and got lost even with Sat Nav (instructions going over flyovers/turnoffs come rapidly and we got confused) but eventually found the hotel. I agree with all the positive comments about this hotel and. I thought it was a very safe residential area. There is a very nice restauran a few mins away between hotel and station, Spanish or Italan? it was very popular and glad we put our names down on our way back from a day in Downtown Boston there were queues early Tues evening. Enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and also the coffee machine and fridge in our bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: dcgirl17
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in May and it was my first visit in Boston! I thought the rooms were really nice and comfortable. The grounds were beautiful and well maintained... the staff was great! they were very responsive to requests and they were all very friendly...I went to a Red Sox Game and the location of this property was perfect to get to Fenway park. The subway is close by and easy to use and only a short ride to the park and downtown. This is the hotel I will go back to when I come back to Boston..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: windows187147
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in a very nice, spacious and comfortable room. The staff was excellent, friendly and very efficient Beautifull garden and well maintained Overall an excellent hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Boston Marathon Runners”
Reviews.Author: marathonrd
Reviews.Content: Our running group has stayed at the Best Western Terrace Inn for a number of years when we come to Boston for marathon weekend. Our stays have been consistently good. The staff is great, friendly and responsive and every year the hotel seems to add another small touch for runners - this year it was water bottles and energy bars in the room. Hotel management has gone out of its way ot accommodate us. The hotel itself is comfortable, moderately priced, in a nice area of Brookline, accessible to the T...far enough from downtown to avoid the price of a downtown hotel, close enough to get there quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: hertsarahh
Reviews.Content: Wow I am stunned! I've booked this hotel online and I had a limited budget to visit Boston with my family. The first thing that surprised me was the price. As I lived in Boston before, I knew it is hard to find a nice hotel with a limited budget. I can easily say that 90% of Boston hotels are more than $200-$300 per night. I got a great deal from Best Western Terrace Inn with an Aquarium Package which was lower than $200 with Aquarium tickets included! Besides the price, their staff was so helpful in each part of my vacation. They also offer free parking, free WI-FI and complimentary breakfast every morning which you cant really have it in any hotels in Boston for FREE! It was a great experience for me and my family. I would never ever try to find another hotel for my next visit! Thank you so much for this great service!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable isn't always good”
Reviews.Author: JrJuniorsMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel last night because we wanted to make an early trip to take some of our son's things home from a college in the area. The area was ok although not anything around to do or eat without getting into your car or using the T. They had free parking which was good since almost every hotel charges you for parking. When we first walked into the room, my first impression was ehhh, it isn't as bad as I thought it would be since I got a little nervous when we pulled up seeing the hotel from the outside. The room looked clean enough, was tastefully decorated and had a refrigerator and microwave. When I went into the bathroom there were ants all over the floor. I killed about 15 of them. That wasn't too bad, I was more concerned with bed bugs... I checked but thank goodness didn't find any. I did find more ants though, crawling on the chair next to the bed. After being itchy all night thinking about ants crawling on me, I slept with my clothes on and sweatshirt hood on my head. That wasn't the worst of it though...during the night I kept getting a faint smell of vomit. I don't know if it was on the rug on my side of the bed or the side of the chair or on the mattress. It wasn't a strong odor but every so often kept getting a whiff. I couldn't figure out where it was coming from, disgusting! I should have asked for another room but quite frankly didn't think it would make much of a difference and I figured they didn't have one since they told me that they were booked when I called. We were only going to be there for a night anyway. To top it off, when we went to grab something to eat, we saw a huge rat in the parking lot. If anybody could have seen me sleeping, you would have laughed at the lunatic sleeping in her clothes with her hood tied up tight, wrinkling up her nose from the puke smell...with one eye open worried about rats coming through the bottom of the door. I've been dragging my rear end all day from lack of sleep then had a 5 hour drive home. To be honest with you, I wouldn't have been so harsh with my review if there were no ants or puke smell, it wouldn't have been too bad because it was surprisingly clean otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable at this price and location.”
Reviews.Author: 3ball
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 20 weeks while working in Boston. The staff was great, the area was quiet, offstreet parking, fresh coffee and conversation with my friend Keith the overnight desk clerk. My home away from home. I actually miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Basic facilities; my experience was not brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond001
Reviews.Content: I checked in on 3rd Dec 2010. It was a cold December evening. Heating in the room did not work. I spoke to Reception who said someone would be there in 10 minutes. No one ever did.

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel at a reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: kipmartin
Reviews.Content: i liked this hotel. its basic but clean, roomy, and located close to the direct route into boston. my only complaint was that BOSTON is too expensive. this was the best deal at this proximity to town. a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “We will certainly return again!”
Reviews.Author: maryninn
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here to attend my mother's funeral. The room was peaceful and clean yet close to the lights and sounds of the city. We will return for a leisure time soon. Thank you Best Western!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful - staff, accomodations, breakfast, and price!”
Reviews.Author: eliza2384
Reviews.Content: We stayed there to attend a funeral, and the hotel was easy to get to, and plenty of places to eat, etc. nearby and it was in a nice neighborhood. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, breakfast was good, and the price was a big help to us as we traveled from Maryland at a time that was unexpected. The room was nicely decorated, and had beautiful granite counters - not what I expected! overall it was really super!

Reviews.Title: “Good customer care”
Reviews.Author: TravelNeed68
Reviews.Content: I want to compliment this hotel and its evening clerk on its great customer care. We arrived at the hotel at 10pm with 2 tired kids. Unfortunately the hotel had been overbooked (by Expedia they said) by 22 rooms. They sent us to their sister hotel and covered the room and parking there. That hotel was larger, closer to central Boston and across the street from a T stop. They really turned what could have a been a debacle into a great experience. I didn't have my reservation nbr with me but the lobby had free internet access so i just looked it up. The clerk was very apologetic and polite. Thank you for taking care of us.

Reviews.Title: “amazing value”
Reviews.Author: charleyPeachlandBc
Reviews.Content: We always searchout Best Western Hotels when travelling as we have found them much like a favourite chain restaurant - you know what to expect!!! The Boston Terrace was a wonderful surprise. We stayed in a room at the back on the hill and although parking was a bit difficult because of the incline we couldn't complain because it was free and in Boston that is sawing something. The breakfast room was a treat and filled us till supper. I have not one complaint with the hotel but restaurants in the area a few... no worries though as the Whole Food market is a bonus with the rooms having both microwaves and fridges. Please consider this hotel for the greatest value in Boston and remember seniors pay only .....75 cents on the train to go into the city, a short and interested ride of 30 minutes. Thanks, The Rodgers

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Access to the T”
Reviews.Author: Julrah
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Best Western many times during the past four years while our daughter has been at BC. It is between two T stops on the "B" line that travels along Commonwealth Ave. and it's also only a 5 block walk from the "C" line stop at Tappan. The FREE parking and breakfast are terrific bonuses! The front desk staff is very helpful and courteous. When we had an air-conditioning issue it was promptly fixed. The rooms are not opulent but are always clean and equipped with fridge and microwave.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE IN BOSTON, GOOD PLACE TO STAY TO SEE BU”
Reviews.Author: LASurfGuy
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Boston to visit BU. Location is perfect. EZ access to Green Line T. Rooms were a bit dated and TV was old, but it was clean and the systems, incuding free wi/fi, worked very well. Staff was very helpful, especially Charles, who may have been the GM. Breakfast is adequate, not fancy. They may consider adding some fresh fruit options. There is a 7/11 store right down on Comm Ave if you need any sundries. Fair price for room. We were on first floor in the back of the property, and it was pretty quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good neighborhood, but a bit too noisy”
Reviews.Author: Badgerjim
Reviews.Content: Boston is not the cheapest place to get a hotel room, so the deal we got here was quite remarkable. As other reviewers have noted, the Best Western offers free parking in a city where a downtown hotel would probably charge at least $20 a day. It's a short walk to the Green Line of the T--though remember that it makes a lot of stops and is not as fast as other mass transit trains in the city. You can get to Boston University or Boston College easily by the train, and that branch runs surprisingly often. we were in town for a Bookcrossing convention being held at Boston U. and found the hotel location and trains very handy. The neighborhood was very pleasant and nice for taking a walk in at night--we felt safe there. Driving from the east on Comm. Ave., watch for a sign painted on a nearby building that tells you how to make a U-turn and turn right after a Gulf station--it can be a touch tricky to get to driving but the sign is very helpful. At the hotel itself, the room numbering system is confusing, so pay close attention to the desk clerk as s/he explains how to get to your room. The room itself was small but clean and functional. It doesn't bother us at all, but some people would prefer an interior corridor to a room like ours that one can reach directly from the street. Check-in was efficient, if not particularly friendly; checkout was friendlier and efficient, too. breakfast was okay--average for this type of hotel--but quite crowded. Noise control was subpar and is why I bumped my review down a notch to three circles. You could hear footsteps easily in the room above, but what was more of a problem was the noise through the adjoining room connected by a locked door. The door insulated noise from next door poorly, and the people next door came in loudly at 2 am and I could hear all of their loud conversations until past 4 am. The noisy neighbors are not the hotel's fault, but they could work on noise control. For my wife's part, she loved the hotel (the next door guests didn't wake her up :-)) . If we were visiting that part of town again and were bringing our car, we would *definitely* consider staying there again--it really is a very good value for Boston, even with its downsides.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Value for Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromVT
Reviews.Content: What a terrific time we had at this hotel. Very clean & comfortable. Spacious rooms with large televisions. Breakfast was well stocked and maintained. Convenient to trolley to take us into the city. This is now our favorite hotel in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “All 'round Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Jerami
Reviews.Content: They had comfy beds and pillows. The staff was extremely helpful. It was located in a safe neighborhood right outside the city of Boston, and right down the street from this great restaurant "Tasca". The hotel is directly across from the T stop. Best sleep i ever had thank you BW

Reviews.Title: “Good value, close to transportation”
Reviews.Author: tu2rgirl
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent location for anyone visiting a student at Boston U. or Boston College, and much less expensive than the downtown hotels. The location is also a two-minute walk to the "T" (train) that goes into downtown Boston. The ride took perhaps 15 or 20 minutes, tops, and the trains run frequently. This is important because parking is all but impossible in Boston. The room, while definitely not luxurious, was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The hotel offers a free breakfast, and overall, for the money, we were more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: charlene2
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at your hotel for a girls getaway weekend. The staff was great and the room was VERY clean. We both would stay here again on our next trip to the Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy housekeeping service”
Reviews.Author: bostour
Reviews.Content: Although, we were told about the linen change on a daily basis, the housekeeping supervisor got away saying that the Front-desk people don't know the facts ! In the entire 2 weeks stay, only once, the carpets were vacuum cleaned. We took the kitchenette room and then the housekeeping guy was asking us why were we cooking !! Had stayed in Best Western elsewhere also but this one seems to be lousy and we didn't get this kind of treatment any where else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a Best Western , but older."”
Reviews.Author: jett54
Reviews.Content: The stay was good but a little noisy, ice was a distance away, and the suite itself was a bit cut-up and didn't "flow" well. It has older windows, rugs,doors, etc. I felt a tiny bit uneasy and was glad to have company. However, the drapes and furnishings were very nice.I hate the "new" lighting most seem to be inclined to use now.The desk clerks, am and pm were very professional and arranged a cab pick-up for us as well as an early wake-up call. Overall, it was close to the "T" line and provided a lovely breakfast. I would stay again and appreciated their hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you can get a good rate.”
Reviews.Author: SteveBoston
Reviews.Content: I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again if I got a good rate. Parking, internet and breakfast are all included in the price. Public transportation is five minutes away (trolley/tram/streetcar). It's about a half hour to downtown Boston. There is not much right near the hotel, a few stores and a couple of restaurants. The Whole Foods is nice except for their right wing political views. If you stay during the warmer part of the year the hotel has a bit of a garden setting which is rare in Boston. The breakfast is not bad. The rooms seem to be recently done over. The bathrooms are quite small, but they do have recessed chrome Kleenex dispensers which you don't see very often now.

Reviews.Title: “sleep tight in Boston”
Reviews.Author: hydesomay
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel because it is a beautifully renovated hotel in the generous living area. It's placed only one block from the nearest T (train) station so it's easy to reach every part of Boston. It also has high-speed internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not great, and not what we expected...”
Reviews.Author: MrsJigsaw
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location is not bad, it's a short walk to the green line train which takes you where ever you need to go, either by itself or connecting to another line. Across the street to the right of the hotel is Mt. Hood Rd, walk to the end of the block and cross by the 7-11, the train comes every few minutes so there's no real wait time. The hotel price was good, and parking on site was free, which is a big plus. Some cons: There was continental breakfast, which is over by 11am, so if you are on vacation or are out late and want to sleep in, you will miss it. We were in room 503, which overlooked the street (Mt. Hood Rd), if we wanted to leave our curtains open to get some light to make up for the dim room lighting, anyone walking by could see into our room clearly. The curtains also sit right on top of the heater, and since it was cold and we wanted it on, but not at the risk of being a fire hazard that made it annoying, I just tucked up the curtains onto the window sill and luckily they stayed without falling. The room was clean enough, though housekeeping did not come the first day we were there, so after a long day exploring Boston we came back to an uncleaned room, no made bed, and no clean towels for the rest of the night or next morning. There is a fridge in the room which kept our drinks cold enough, and there is a microwave that was working. There is a coffee pot but we only got one pouch of regular coffee and 4 decafs, and the pot only makes one cup at a time. The room was smaller than we had thought, the bathroom is tiny and if you are with a significant other and would like to both use the bathroom when getting ready in the morning, forget that, it's too small. The tv channels were fine and there are movies offered, $13.99 if you want to watch a movie still in theaters, and $11.99 for any other movie (guess that's where they make up for the free parking). We got a good deal from Hotels.com with every second night half off, and that was the seller for us, plus when we called the hotel they said we were right near everything, we were near the train that takes you to everything, there's nothing really in walking distance but the train, 7-11 and whole foods around the corner. There's no restaurant or bar on the premises but you can take the train if you want to go out, there's also no room service so you need to bring food with you if you want to eat in. The trains stop running at 12:30 so if you plan on a late night out, you'll have to cab it back to the hotel, if you are not driving. Overall I would recommend spending a little bit more for a nicer hotel, maybe further down commonwealth ave. The hotel is also hidden behind a Gulf station so we almost missed it when we were looking for it and the parking lot is pretty hilly in the back area and not a lot of parking on the side we were on by Mt. Hood Rd. If you're on a budget this is an ok place, I would definitely classify it as 2 stars however, not 3.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs beware!”
Reviews.Author: jehj33
Reviews.Content: We call this place the bedbug motel. We stayed there a few times while my son was in college close by. It never was very nice but the parking was free. The last time we stayed there I noticed that the fabric on the side of the box spring had been sliced open. I wondered what was going on... The next day I had bites all over my legs!! I guess they made an attempt to deal with the bedbugs but obviously they should have just thrown out all the furnishings and fumigated. Beware - don't stay at the Bedbug Motel.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute - Good find”
Reviews.Author: ornella
Reviews.Content: Due to a snowstorm, the roads were terrible and we needed to get off the highway at 1am. We past a Sheraton but I didn't want to pay $150 or more for quick 8hr stay. The GPS pointed out this Best Western. At 1am, the front desk open and the gentleman at the desk was friendly. On a walk-in, he offered a room with 2 queen beds for $109. I took it. The room was clean. Free parking. Continental breakfast was avail in the morning. That is all I needed. Overall, we got lucky considering how late it was. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Way Out in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Bittern
Reviews.Content: Best Western Terrace Inn, 1650 Commonwealth Avenue, Boston, MA, USA Stayed: Sep 2008, one night double room. Location: Actually on Mount Hood Road off Commonwealth Avenue, between Washington Street and Sutherland Street Boston MBTA Green Line B tram stops. The tram journey is roughly 40-50 mins from Park Street and Government Centre Downtown stations, so the hotel is not very handy for doing things in the centre of the city. There are few facilities near the hotel (The hotel staff said: one Thai, one Italian restaurant, a 7-11 shop and a pharmacy-cum-US mail office-we found them very near). The Hotel is more of a Motel, with three separate blocks: reception and two separate bedroom blocks, which have no covered ways between them, so if it is raining â€¦ There are steps to reception but there is access by ramp via dining area for wheel-chairs. Bedroom block 1xx (ground)-2xx has no lift to upper floor. Did not assess block with rooms 3xx-5xx. Being just off Commonwealth Avenue saves it from traffic noise, so it is quieter than one may anticipate. The room we had was plain, but very spacious and cleanâ€”no criticism of that. The welcome was pleasant and helpful but the â€˜Continental breakfastâ€™ was at the poorer end of the scale: cereals, yoghourt, fresh fruit, bread and rolls / bagels but no meats or cheeses. The fruit juices were really diluted fruit â€™drinksâ€™ rather than fresh or 100% reconstituted. The â€˜crockeryâ€™ is of the plasticised paper variety plus plastic â€˜glassesâ€™ and polystyrene-foam tea/coffee containers (â€˜cupsâ€™). Similarly, the cutlery is plastic, with no large spoon. The hotel was willing to extend check-out time by one hour (to noon) and to safe-keep luggage after check-out until later in the day. Is this the Boston location or quality you want for $171 ($192 incl. taxes)?

Reviews.Title: “Some very good points”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyBike
Reviews.Content: First of all, it was well situated for us. We took the tram/subway to visit downtown. We felt quite safe in the neighborhood where the hotel is situated. The hotel itself has been semi-renovated and is clean and acceptably furnished. We were pleasantly surprised by the breakfast, it's self-serve but they have eggs, waffles, cereal, fruit, and toast. We found the staff to be very courteous and pleasant. Also, there was an error in our reservation (our fault), but they were able to accommodate the dates change at no cost, which we very much appreciated. We found the rate a bit expensive at $184, but be aware that Boston is very expensive compared to other cities.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: griff08
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Priceline, and we were looking for a Fenway weekend. The hotel was obvious, because it really is in the back of a gas station parking lot. Check-in at the front desk was super easy, and the front desk clerk was so friendly, helpful and polite! Check-in literally took less than 30 seconds, including when he asked if we wanted 1st or 2nd floor. The rooms are set up like they might be in warmer climates - instead of everything in one building, there were several groups of 2-story buildings with maybe 10 or so rooms in each group. There's parking on site (and it's FREE - a total luxury in Boston) and the whole time I felt safe, even parking my new car out there. The room was nothing special - not huge or anything, but it was absolutely spotless. Fridge, microwave, desk, wireless internet all right there. Even the bathroom didn't have one speck of mold or dirt. It's even environmentally friendly, with those signs you can leave out if you can handle using the towels and sheets more than once. We got directions to both walk to Fenway (it's about 1.5 miles) or take the train (T is about a 4 minute walk) and how to get back after a night of baseball and drinking. :) I would definitely stay at this hotel again, and recommend it to anyone who asked. It's in a quiet neighborhood, only a short distance to the T, and the price wasn't bad at all for Boston area. A+

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and clean.”
Reviews.Author: rdmac4550
Reviews.Content: Stayed with wife and 2 teenage kids for 5 nights. Paid about $175/night. Half a block from the Washington St T stop; Green Line. Free parking. Wireless. Pretty good breakfast. Very good service. Fritz ran the front desk and he was great. Rooms aren't very big but very clean. Location is very good and you can save a few bucks by using the T. No pool. They don't change towels or sheets unless you ask. Knowledgable staff and helpful. Recommended, especially given the prices in Boston. It's no great bargin but affordable. Some very good places to eat close by.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated. Great for this class of hotels”
Reviews.Author: Pat&Georges
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered preferred rates for a student conference at Harvard. We picked it because it was the cheapest and permitted four students in one room and free parking without extra charges. The positive: one block walk to the "T" subway system on the Boston College line. Very nice continental breakfast with fresh bagels, muffins, hard boiled egges etc and made to order waffles. The rooms are being renovated and all three of ours were renovated. I have to say the pillows and mattresses were new &comfortable and the rooms completely quiet -- I hate traffic sounds. The neighborhood behind it is up and coming, decent for a walk. Near to Newton and Boston College. Small efficiency kitchen with a fridge, microwave and dishes was handy. The desk staff were extremely helpful. Free wireless access and a free PC in the lobby for internet access. Negative: given that I was not expecting a resort, I really have nothing negative other than we were awoken at 8am on Monday morning by the rehab of a nearby room. My call to the front desk brought an apology and I was told they were not expecting the workers until 9:30am and had already asked them to stop...which they did. The other negative is that the property is a little out of the way for the main Boston sights, about a 30 minute subway ride to government center (a major depot for all lines) and about 50-60 minutes from the airport. For Harvard, the desk staff advised that we take the T four stops and switch to the 66 busline which took us right into Harvard Square.. a half hour in total. Otherwise, the T alone would have taken about an hour. I highly recommend the mulit-day passes. Our 7 day pass (covers trains and buses) for $15.00 was a good buy, considering the one way tickets on the T are $2.00. Use it to commute all over the city and to the airport. Cannot be bought at the airport but take the free shuttle to the subway and bye it there from the ticket machines.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place For the Money”
Reviews.Author: leelee67Ma
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel for the money..My husband had to have surgery at Brigham and Womens..We decided to head up the night before surgery. Free parking was great. The breakfast was also good. I can not say enough about Felipe.. He drove us to the hospital the day of surgery and made sure that i returned to the hotel safely. He went the extra mile. Ask for Felipe if you need a ride. Thank You Felipe...Lisa and Gary..

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Irishys
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through a college website. It was listed as a hotel in the vicinity of Boston College and close to downtown Boston. We were planning a trip to see the some of the colleges in Boston and didn't want to spend a fortune...so we booked it. BIG MISTAKE. I knew we were in trouble when we saw it was practically in the parking lot of a gas station...it's just behind the Gulf station. The check in was fine, people were friendly and helpful but when I saw the room I nearly cried. It looked dirty. The room was dingy and old...really fairly run down. The bathroom had a frosted window...no curtain...that looked out on the parking lot. If you opened the bathroom window...anyone outside had a full view in. We all felt so uncomfortable that we cut our stay down from 2 nights to 1. We just couldn't sleep there. It's location is closest to Boston College but it was a bit of a trip to Boston U and NorthEastern U. What the Best Western considers a "shuttle service" is actually the Boston Subway system. This hotel is located on the very outskirts of Boston. It is in a rather "seedy" area and we really didn't feel safe waiting for the subway or walking back to the hotel at night. It took about 35 - 45 minutes by subway to get into downtown Boston. It was not a pleasant ride. We loved Boston itself , it is a great place to visit. My advice is to spend a bit more for a clean bed/bathroom and get closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet place in the BIG city...”
Reviews.Author: catkins522
Reviews.Content: A nice plae to stay in Boston. My room was above par. The only thing subpar was the bath. It really needed a cleaning. Plus, my key card was not working the 2nd day. However, within 5 minutes, my key was working again. If you are staying in the city, mass transit will work. The hotel was in a block of the T, the subway. Close to Fenway, the Pops, and the piers.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Boston”
Reviews.Author: sharonaOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. It is easy to get to the heart of Boston on the subway. The rooms are spacious and the free breakfast is good. We got there early and they let us check in early. The area seems safe. We would stay there again for sure. We covered the stay using over Airmiles, which was an extra score.

Reviews.Title: “nice experience”
Reviews.Author: travels68
Reviews.Content: The staff was great to us and the rooms were immaculate. The rooms were extremely clean. We were visiting boston university with my daughter and it was only a ten minute ride on the train that is only one block from the hotel. I was impressed when the staff informed me that the hotel will be completely renovated by April. They have a great breakfast that is served in the lobby with tea, coffee, cereal, waffles, and a lot more. The free parking is something that you can't find in many places around boston. We also took the train to downtown one day and it was really convenient. The hotel and staff exceeded my expectations. The hotel was great and I can't wait to go back and see what its like after the renovations are complete. I will back here every time I am back in boston.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: treetravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because the Boston College website listed it as a local place to stay. We planned on staying two nights and we had booked two rooms at a rate of $169.00 per night. When we arrived my husband commented that it looked like "The Bates Motel". Once inside our room - we were horrified. The room had been decorated in the 70's and had never been updated. It was extremely shabby and the bedspreads and carpet were stained. Worst of all was the disgusting smell of smoke and stale air. It was so bad that we told the front desk clerk that we didn't want to stay there - the clerk informed us that he may have to charge us anyway. We told him fine, knowing that we would stop our credit card payment and make a formal complaint against the hotel. Our trip to the Boston area ended up lovely. We checked into the Doubleday Suites and were very happy there. The rate at this hotel was actually less expensive because a two room suite was $199.00 and accommodated our family just fine. The bottom line is DON'T stay at the Best Western Inn in Boston. There are so many other options of great places to stay!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but some cons”
Reviews.Author: Traveller21345
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in October. The hotel was very clean, seemed to be in a very safe neighborhood, and provided an adequate breakfast. It was a one block walk from the Green line (B branch, Washington St). However, the hotel is rather far from downtown. The trolley ride is very very slow and tedious and I found the green B line trains to be the most infrequent. As such, it usually took us at least 30 minutes to get to downtown. In addition, on the second night, we were kept awake by a loud party from about 2am-3am. I called the front desk, but found them to be extremely unhelpful and completely unconcerned. The hotel was the best value that I could find that was still in a decent neighborhood. Again, it was clean and there were no problems with the room itself. However, due to its inconvenient location and unhelpful staff, I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great area, NOT great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelSchmavel
Reviews.Content: I ended up getting this hotel through Priceline. There was a conference in town and I had a hard time finding anything else, even through regular reservations. Overall, I was very disappointed. To start off, my first room had a shower that the wall had been busted out and mold wasv everywhere. There was also no kitchen and the hotel lists that every room has a kitchen (it must be saved for Priceline customers). I was moved promptly to a room a bit larger, with a kitchen, and at least it was in tact. Pros: - Staff was nice, unexperienced, but nice - Location was quiet, residential, and right next to the T Cons: - Very dirty! The bathroom was infested with house centipedes...I saw a family of them. - Bathtub did not drain (took about an hour after the shower was finished. I asked everyday for it to be fixed, but it never was. - Large groups stay here. While the neighborhood is quiet, the group can have lots of parties. - Non-smoking room smelled of thick smoke. I did report my unhappiness to the corporate office and they said I would be contacted by management. No one ever contacted me. This hotel has potential because of the location, but need a complete overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Lakeshore18
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was very close to Boston University where we were dropping our daughter off for graduate school. The area was fine..... we were able to walk to a grab a bite to eat in the surrounding area without difficulty. The free parking was a definite plus. Our main gripe was with the room which was very, very damp. It was a warm night, but the whole room and even the bed linens felt very humid and damp. Also, the free breakfast was only marginal. Too many people scurrying for a table and towards the end of the designated hours they stopped putting out more food so all you could have was what was picked over by others. We'll be looking for another place to stay when we go back to visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Best Western”
Reviews.Author: pampita
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my 14 month old daughter for a week in June of 2006. The room was supposed to be a non-smoking room but certainly didnâ€™t smell that way. The area seemed OK â€“ however we did hear what sounded like 8 gunshots at about 3am â€“ which didnâ€™t exactly make us feel secure. The room was basically clean but hadnâ€™t been refurbished in what seemed like years and so didnâ€™t feel really clean. The first portable crib they sent was broken. The staff wasnâ€™t too bad â€“ but not as responsive as I wanted â€“ it took them a day to fix the AC/heat in our room. Not the worst Iâ€™ve stayed in by any means â€“ but definitely not the best. It wasnâ€™t up to the standard I expect out of Best Western. I probably wouldnâ€™t stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great tourist value”
Reviews.Author: roxygypsy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Best Western Terrace Inn as a $99.per night special from a GO Boston card I ordered online through their tourism dept. I called a few days in advance to reserve; it really was only $99. per night. It was right on the green line, although almost at the outside edge, near Boston Univ. West. But in 25 min., you were downtown! No driving! Free parking, okay rooms, free "expanded" continental breakfast (waffles, cereal, fruit, etc. A wonderful Spanish restaurant was around the corner. Friendly staff. For the price, we were able to stay an extra day! The Marriot at the Embarcadero charges $40. per day just to park!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with Free Parking, But Not A Favorite”
Reviews.Author: luv4trvl
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Terrace Inn. It is located in a very nice area. The room was large, but we tended to both roll to the center of the bed, making it 2 long nights. Loved the short 3-block walk to the MTA line for the convenience of taking public transportation, especially since the "Dig Collapse" had made car travel even more difficult. Parking was free, which is a big plus in Boston. The ice machine was located about a block away in a different building. On our last day, it was helpful to be able to leave our luggage in a room off the lobby, before being picked up to go to the airport. However, the staff failed to deliver a message to us from the shuttle service saying they would be 20-minutes late, even though we were sitting in the lobby reading. This caused us some anxiety and an unneeded call to the shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: golemjohnny
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about it. Don't go there. Don't stay there. Avoid it like the plague Best Western should be ashamed

Reviews.Title: “2 rooms out of 3....not bad????????”
Reviews.Author: joekg
Reviews.Content: The Terrace Inn is very convenient, is well maintained, has a reasonable breakfast, and is reasonably priced for Boston. I would have liked to rate this hotel 5 stars but an annoying thing happened when I stayed there recently. I made reservations for ***3 rooms*** at this hotel 5 months prior to the date because it was Boston University graduation weekend (my wife and I and 2 other relatives were coming up). I called several times over the 5 months to make sure we stil had our ***3 rooms***. Each time we were reasured the reservation was there for ***3 rooms***. We got a letter from them stating since it was a busy weekend our deposit was non refundable if we canceled within a few weeks of the date. Not nice but we accepted that since we were coming for sure. We arrived on the day, came in at 1:30 pm. They told us they had our ***3 rooms*** reserved but they were not ready yet. No problem, we would leave our luggage there, see the sights of wonderful Boston and return after dinner. Just to be safe, I called at 3:30 pm to see if we needed to do anything else for our ***3 room*** reservation. "No" they said, everything was taken care of, we had our ***3 rooms***. We returned at 9:30 pm to be told we had ????? 2 rooms, not 3. "We overbooked and since you had 3 rooms we thought you could get by with 2" they said nicely (I have no complaints about the weekend night manager, he was stuck with the situation he didnt create). All of Boston was booked, it was late, they gave us $20 off each room, and gave us two rooms- a suite with two rooms the relatives had to share and a room with two single beds for me and my wife. The next morning I requested and got an additional room. Upon checking out I asked the manager how this happened and he said "We don't do this on purpose, it just sometimes happens". That was it. You other travellers can tell me if this happens frequently to you (has never happened to me in 49 years) I emailed the Best Western office, they said I would hear within a week (haven't heard anything in 1 1/2 weeks) from the Terrace Inn. We got by ok for one night, it wasn't THAT big of a deal but my questions are: if you can take ALL my money if I don't show up, why can't you make sure everyone who puts that money up has a room? Have you looked into this "mistake" to see how often it happens? Wouldn't it be nice to respond to questions referred from the main office? So I suggest they study the overbook policy OR drop that no refund policy on busy weekends. If you make reservations, you might want to have a cancelable reservation somewhere else JUST IN CASE.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Terrace Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1650 Commonwealth Ave, Boston, MA 02135
